column4: Does anyone know offhand how to make dhcpd forward the dns server ipaddresses the dhcp server is using to its dhcp clients?
I'm sure I made it do that at some point.
it doesn't do that by default?
I don't know, it doesn't seem to be doing that.
It seems like the client just doesn't get any DNS.
(I'm using my Windows laptop as the client, ipconfig /all shows no DNS server)
option domain-name-servers in dhcpd.conf I think
I am aware of that, but afaik there's no "auto" option.
So I'd have to come up with one that will always work.
Ah. I see what you mean
Bah, maybe I should just figure out why named doesn't seem to work.
you want it to hand out the DNS server the the machine itself is using at that particular time?
I could certainly do it with a bit of shell scripting magic, but that seems kludgey.
I don't know if it's supported by default
